raw_comment:
I've found that, compared to typical students, Legacy students have an approximately twofold higher chance of being accepted into Elite universities. Additionally, I saw that the graph fell at the 85th percentile, but then it shot up to seven times higher acceptance rates. Why does the graph dip at about the 85th percentile, I wonder? In addition, I'm curious as to why, up until approximately the 50th percentile, neither graph changes significantly; after that, they start to diverge until the 99th percentile. In my neighborhood, I can relate to this because I'm a high school student approaching the age when students need to start thinking seriously about college. Resources like these assist students understand the admission rates to different universities.

"Knowledge is Liberty"
ace_sentences: Legacy students have an approximately twofold higher chance of acceptance into elite universities than typical students.
The graph fell at about the 85th percentile.
After that, the graph rose to about seven times higher acceptance rates.
I wonder why the graph dips at about the 85th percentile.
I am curious about two graphs.
Up to about the 50th percentile, neither graph changes significantly.
After about the 50th percentile, the two graphs start to diverge.
The two graphs diverge until the 99th percentile.
I am a high school student.
At that age, students need to start thinking seriously about college.
These resources help students understand the admission rates to different universities.
